drafting press materials and e-newsletters

key_responsibilities: managing the front desk

office: House Judiciary Subcommittee on Immigration and Citizenship
key_responsibilities: serving as a resource for Democratic Members of the Judiciary Committee on matters involving immigration law and policy
drafting legislation
coordinating hearings and witnesses
preparing Members for hearings and markups
drafting statements, memos, and briefing materials
providing guidance to other offices within the Democratic Caucus on immigration-related matters
requirements: strong background in immigration law and policy
ability to work closely and collaboratively with other congressional offices and advocacy organizations
minimum of five years of experience in immigration law

key_responsibilities: overseeing all operations of the district office
development and implementation of policy objectives, strategies, and operating plans
direct all activities and staff of the district office
recruiting, hiring, training, and managing district staff
ensuring that district staff complies with office policies, practices, and procedures
representing the Member and/or assigns appropriate staff to do so at events or functions through the district as needed
strategizing, developing, and implementing district communications and outreach plan for constituents
casework management
serving as the primary liaison between the Congresswoman and constituents and special interest groups in the district
acting as an advisor for the Congresswoman on local concerns, district issues and politics, and other developments throughout the region
requirements: minimum of 3-5 years of management experience
strong ability to provide necessary organization, leadership and motivation to manage a Congressional office
excellent oral and written communication skills
thorough knowledge of the legislative process
willing to work evenings and weekends in a fast-paced and demanding setting

key_responsibilities: formulating legislative initiatives for assigned issue areas
tracking legislation and other developments in assigned issue areas and briefing the Congresswoman for floor work, committee work, work in the district, and outside House-related activities
monitoring legislative developments within relevant committees
planning and coordinating cosponsorship and support of legislation
writing floor speeches for the Congresswoman
acting as liaison with committee and agency staffs
performing special projects assigned by the Congresswoman or Chief of Staff
meeting with constituents and interest groups
assisting with the preparation of weekly reports for the Congresswoman and staff on legislative activities in assigned issue areas
performing other duties as assigned
requirements: excellent written and verbal communication skills
strong organizational and time management skills
solid knowledge of the legislative process
ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines in an fast-paced work environment

key_responsibilities: overseeing a collaborative and strategic scheduling operation
ensuring a one-stop-shop model for all DC constituent interactions
maximizing each dollar of the Members Representational Allowance (MRA) in serving the constituents of the First District
taking a larger role overall in office strategy and goalsetting
maintaining the Congressman's schedule, travel plans, and related records
acting as a liaison for the Congressman with the staff, public, industry, Members of Congress, and Administration officials
tracking bills and vendor contracts
creating vouchers for payment by the Finance office
tracking and submitted Member and staff reimbursements
keeping equipment inventory current and well documented
recommending year end equipment and supply purchases to the Chief and Member
maintaining and submitting all travel and purchase card statements
making sure the office complies with all ethics criteria
supervising the staff assistant and front office operations
coordinating with the Staff Assistant on the hiring, training, and maintenance of the intern program
requirements: able to handle a fast-paced and demanding work environment
temperament to communicate with a variety of personalities in a pleasant and professional manner

key_responsibilities: serving in an important advisory capacity for the Member
working closely with the Chief of Staff, District Scheduler, communications, and policy teams to coordinate the Member’s official schedule and arrange travel plans
managing the Member’s daily and long-term DC schedule
evaluating, organizing and responding to all incoming DC meeting requests
creating and booking complex travel arrangements
coordinating with the campaign staff on political scheduling requests
occasionally spearheading other projects as assigned
requirements: ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks under tight deadlines
ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment
strong written and verbal communication skills
ability to work collaboratively as part of a close-knit team

key_responsibilities: planning and implementing a communications strategy across a broad portfolio
working closely with legislative, district, and appropriations staff to effectively communicate her message
handling daily media inquiries
maintaining relationships with national and local reporters
writing talking points and press releases
pitching op-eds
managing the website
producing videos and social media content
planning and pitching press events in DC and the district
overseeing daily clips
keeping press lists up-to-date
requirements: strong writing and oral communication skills
ability to multitask and prioritize under pressure

key_responsibilities: managing and maintaining a high-volume constituent correspondence system
ensuring that responses to constituent letters are completed in a timely manner
conducting any research necessary to formulate response to letters
creating and maintaining a collection of prepared responses for use in responding to constituent mail
working with members of the Legislative staff to ensure correspondence is up to date
managing the approval chain from legislative staff to the Member of Congress
supervising the printing and proofreading of form letters
assisting Communications team with 499 strategy and implementation
drafting responses to constituent mail that cannot be answered with a form letter
organizing incoming correspondence and maintaining Fireside system
compiling weekly mail reports for the Member and legislative staff including mail volume, processing statistics, and policy issues raised in incoming constituent mail
assisting with answering phones as needed
reporting to the Legislative Director
performing other duties as assigned
requirements: excellent research, writing and communication skills
ability to exercise discretion, use independent judgement, and work cooperatively and courteously with others
availability to work long hours and at night

key_responsibilities: working with the Communications Director based in DC to execute comprehensive national and district media outreach, public relations and communication strategies
acting as Member’s primary spokesperson
providing logistical and technical support to Congressman Schrader for radio and television interviews
proactively seeking media opportunities and working with the Communications Director to manage and catalogue incoming media requests

assisting in managing the official website, crafting social media posts including Facebook and Twitter posts, designing graphics, monitoring social channels, and shooting and editing professional videos using office technology and Adobe Creative Suite
in coordination with the Communications Director, drafting press releases, talking points, speeches, op-eds, newsletters, questionnaires, and other written materials
maintaining and updating both national and district press lists and drafting and distributing media advisories
managing logistics for town halls, Oregon press conferences, and other public-facing events, both virtual and in-person
supporting on administrative functions of the office as needed such as constituent calls and data entry
performing other duties as assigned
requirements: working knowledge of Oregon’s 5th Congressional District
understanding of Oregon’s print, broadcast, and online media landscape
strong written and oral, and organization skills
capacity to work both independently and as part of a team

key_responsibilities: coordinating mail and casework distribution
answering the phones
preparing letters of greetings, condolences and congratulations on behalf of the Member
casework assignments
recruiting, training, scheduling and assigning duties to interns
requirements: significant experience interacting with the public
resident of the District of Columbia or willing to move immediately to D.C.
salary: based on skill and experience level

key_responsibilities: managing a team to prepare and staff hearings and markups, draft legislation, and advise staff and Members of Congress on legislative and non-legislative matters
working with the Chairman, Subcommittee Chair, and Senior Committee Staff to set and implement Subcommittee priorities, strategy, and messaging
advising Members of Congress and their staffs on the issues before the Subcommittee
requirements: minimum of 6 years of Congressional experience or other relevant experience, including experience developing and managing a team
strong background and knowledge of issues within the Subcommittee’s jurisdiction
thorough understanding of the legislative process and the organization and procedures of the House of Representatives
superior writing, analytical, and legislative skills
sound political judgment and the ability to think creatively to design and implement Subcommittee priorities and strategies
proven ability to perform under pressure while juggling multiple tasks with competing priorities and excellent organizational and time management skills
willingness to work long hours and weekends
experience working with relevant public interest groups, agencies, Members of Congress and their staffs, and industry stakeholders

key_responsibilities: managing the Member’s daily and long-term schedule in D.C.
working in close coordination with the district scheduler
managing invitations and scheduling requests
travel and logistical details
acting as a liaison to constituent groups

comfortable dealing with a wide variety of people and stakeholders
previous Capitol Hill scheduling or other scheduling experience

key_responsibilities: managing and organizing incoming communications from constituents, and drafting substantive written responses in a timely manner

engaging with constituents directly to provide more specific responses when appropriate, and working with both the legislative and communications teams to manage a robust, proactive constituent outreach operation
managing and recruiting the office’s interns
requirements: able to work both collaboratively and individually
able to produce high quality work in a fast-paced environment

travel plans

key_responsibilities: maintaining the Member’s daily and long-term schedules for both DC and the District
